title: 10 Insights from Arizona School Enrollment Data
text: Arizona one America’s fastest-growing states, enrollment growth slowed dramatically. state peaked around 2019 flat since.
code: enr <- fetch_enr_multi(2011:2025)  state_totals <- enr |>   filter(is_state, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") |>   select(end_year, n_students) |>   mutate(change = n_students - lag(n_students),          pct_change = round(change / lag(n_students) * 100, 2))  state_totals ggplot(state_totals, aes(x = end_year, y = n_students)) +   geom_line(linewidth = 1.2, color = "#BF0A30") +   geom_point(size = 3, color = "#BF0A30") +   scale_y_continuous(labels = scales::comma) +   labs(     title = "Arizona Public School Enrollment (2011-2025)",     subtitle = "Rapid growth has stalled in recent years",     x = "School Year (ending)",     y = "Total Enrollment"   )

what: 2. Mesa Unified is shrinking while Gilbert grows
title: 10 Insights from Arizona School Enrollment Data
text: Mesa Unified, Arizona’s largest district, lost thousands students neighboring Gilbert Public Schools surged past 40,000.
code: mesa_gilbert <- enr |>   filter(is_district, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL",          grepl("Mesa Unified|Gilbert", district_name)) |>   select(end_year, district_name, n_students) |>   pivot_wider(names_from = end_year, values_from = n_students)  mesa_gilbert enr |>   filter(is_district, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL",          grepl("Mesa Unified|Gilbert", district_name)) |>   ggplot(aes(x = end_year, y = n_students, color = district_name)) +   geom_line(linewidth = 1.2) +   geom_point(size = 2) +   scale_y_continuous(labels = scales::comma) +   labs(     title = "Mesa vs Gilbert: Diverging Enrollment Paths",     subtitle = "Gilbert surges while Mesa declines",     x = "School Year",     y = "Enrollment",     color = "District"   )

title: 10 Insights from Arizona School Enrollment Data
text: Arizona kindergarten enrollment dropped 10% COVID hasn’t fully recovered, signaling smaller cohorts years come.
code: covid_grades <- enr |>   filter(is_state, subgroup == "total_enrollment",          grade_level %in% c("K", "01", "06", "09"),          end_year %in% 2019:2025) |>   select(end_year, grade_level, n_students) |>   pivot_wider(names_from = grade_level, values_from = n_students)  covid_grades

title: 10 Insights from Arizona School Enrollment Data
text: Hispanic students now comprise 45% Arizona enrollment, making largest demographic group state’s public schools.
code: enr_2025 <- fetch_enr(2025)  demographics <- enr_2025 |>   filter(is_state, grade_level == "TOTAL",          subgroup %in% c("hispanic", "white", "black", "asian", "native_american", "multiracial")) |>   mutate(pct = round(pct * 100, 1)) |>   select(subgroup, n_students, pct) |>   arrange(desc(n_students))  demographics demographics |>   mutate(subgroup = forcats::fct_reorder(subgroup, n_students)) |>   ggplot(aes(x = n_students, y = subgroup, fill = subgroup)) +   geom_col(show.legend = FALSE) +   geom_text(aes(label = paste0(pct, "%")), hjust = -0.1) +   scale_x_continuous(labels = scales::comma, expand = expansion(mult = c(0, 0.15))) +   scale_fill_brewer(palette = "Set2") +   labs(     title = "Arizona Student Demographics (2025)",     subtitle = "Hispanic students are now the largest group",     x = "Number of Students",     y = NULL   )

what: 5. Phoenix Elementary has lost half its students
title: 10 Insights from Arizona School Enrollment Data
text: Phoenix Elementary School District, serving central Phoenix, hemorrhaged enrollment charters suburban flight past decade.
code: phoenix_elem <- enr |>   filter(is_district, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL",          grepl("Phoenix Elementary", district_name)) |>   select(end_year, district_name, n_students) |>   mutate(pct_of_peak = round(n_students / max(n_students) * 100, 1))  phoenix_elem

title: 10 Insights from Arizona School Enrollment Data
text: Arizona expansive charter school sector nation, 200,000 students—nearly 20% enrollment.
code: state_total <- enr_2025 |>   filter(is_state, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") |>   pull(n_students)  charter_total <- enr_2025 |>   filter(is_charter, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") |>   summarize(charter_total = sum(n_students, na.rm = TRUE)) |>   pull(charter_total)  tibble(   sector = c("All Public Schools", "Charter Schools"),   enrollment = c(state_total, charter_total),   pct = c(100, round(charter_total / state_total * 100, 1)) )

title: 10 Insights from Arizona School Enrollment Data
text: Arizona one nation’s largest Native American student populations, significant enrollment reservation-based schools.
code: native_am <- enr_2025 |>   filter(is_district, subgroup == "native_american", grade_level == "TOTAL") |>   arrange(desc(n_students)) |>   head(10) |>   select(district_name, n_students, pct)  native_am

what: 8. The Southeast Valley is Arizona’s growth engine
title: 10 Insights from Arizona School Enrollment Data
text: Queen Creek, Chandler, Gilbert districts Southeast Valley among fastest-growing state.
code: se_valley <- enr |>   filter(is_district, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL",          grepl("Queen Creek|Chandler|Gilbert|Higley", district_name),          end_year %in% c(2015, 2025)) |>   group_by(district_name) |>   summarize(     y2015 = n_students[end_year == 2015],     y2025 = n_students[end_year == 2025],     pct_change = round((y2025 / y2015 - 1) * 100, 1),     .groups = "drop"   ) |>   arrange(desc(pct_change))  se_valley

title: 10 Insights from Arizona School Enrollment Data
text: Arizona’s English learner population grown immigration, particularly Phoenix Tucson.
code: ell <- enr_2025 |>   filter(is_state, grade_level == "TOTAL",          subgroup %in% c("lep", "total_enrollment")) |>   select(subgroup, n_students, pct)  ell

what: 10. Tucson Unified is Arizona’s second city
title: 10 Insights from Arizona School Enrollment Data
text: Tucson Unified School District, 40,000 students, anchors Southern Arizona demographics quite different Phoenix metro.
code: tucson <- enr_2025 |>   filter(is_district, grade_level == "TOTAL",          grepl("Tucson Unified", district_name),          subgroup %in% c("total_enrollment", "hispanic", "white", "black")) |>   select(district_name, subgroup, n_students, pct)  tucson

title: 10 Insights from Arizona School Enrollment Data
text: Arizona’s school enrollment data reveals: Stalled growth: boom state’s enrollment plateaued Charter dominance: 1 5 students charter schools Hispanic plurality: 45% students Hispanic Urban-suburban shift: Core districts shrink outer ring grows Native American presence: Significant reservation-based enrollment patterns shape school funding debates facility planning across Grand Canyon State. Data sourced Arizona Department Education Research Evaluation.

title: Arizona School Data
text: Arizona one America’s fastest-growing states, enrollment growth slowed dramatically. state peaked around 2019 flat since.

title: Arizona School Data
Arizona School Data
code: library(azschooldata) library(dplyr)  # Fetch one year enr_2025 <- fetch_enr(2025)  # Fetch multiple years enr_multi <- fetch_enr_multi(2020:2025)  # State totals enr_2025 %>%   filter(is_state, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL")  # District breakdown enr_2025 %>%   filter(is_district, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") %>%   arrange(desc(n_students))  # Demographics enr_2025 %>%   filter(is_state, grade_level == "TOTAL",          subgroup %in% c("hispanic", "white", "black", "asian", "native_american")) %>%   select(subgroup, n_students, pct)

title: Arizona School Data
code: import pyazschooldata as az  # Fetch one year enr_2025 = az.fetch_enr(2025)  # Fetch multiple years enr_multi = az.fetch_enr_multi([2020, 2021, 2022, 2023, 2024, 2025])  # State totals state_total = enr_2025[     (enr_2025['is_state'] == True) &     (enr_2025['subgroup'] == 'total_enrollment') &     (enr_2025['grade_level'] == 'TOTAL') ]  # District breakdown districts = enr_2025[     (enr_2025['is_district'] == True) &     (enr_2025['subgroup'] == 'total_enrollment') &     (enr_2025['grade_level'] == 'TOTAL') ].sort_values('n_students', ascending=False)  # Demographics demographics = enr_2025[     (enr_2025['is_state'] == True) &     (enr_2025['grade_level'] == 'TOTAL') &     (enr_2025['subgroup'].isin(['hispanic', 'white', 'black', 'asian', 'native_american'])) ][['subgroup', 'n_students', 'pct']]

what: azschooldata: Fetch and Process Arizona School Data — azschooldata-package
title: azschooldata: Fetch and Process Arizona School Data — azschooldata-package
text: Downloads processes school enrollment data Arizona Department Education (ADE). Provides functions fetching October 1 enrollment data Accountability & Research division transforming tidy format analysis.

title: azschooldata: Fetch and Process Arizona School Data — azschooldata-package
text: fetch_enr Fetch enrollment data school year fetch_enr_multi Fetch enrollment data multiple years tidy_enr Transform wide data tidy (long) format id_enr_aggs Add aggregation level flags enr_grade_aggs Create grade-level aggregations

title: azschooldata: Fetch and Process Arizona School Data — azschooldata-package
text: cache_status View cached data files clear_cache Remove cached data files

title: azschooldata: Fetch and Process Arizona School Data — azschooldata-package
text: Arizona uses following ID system: Entity IDs (CTDSNumber): Variable length numeric IDs LEAs schools Entity names identify whether district, charter, school

title: azschooldata: Fetch and Process Arizona School Data — azschooldata-package
text: Data sourced Arizona Department Education: Accountability & Research: https://www.azed.gov/accountability-research/data October 1 Enrollment Reports published annually

title: azschooldata: Fetch and Process Arizona School Data — azschooldata-package
text: Data available 2011 present: Era 1 (2011-2017): Original Excel format multiple tabs Era 2 (2018-2023): Updated format FY notation demographic breakdowns Era 3 (2024-present): Simplified naming convention Note: Historical data 1990s-2000s exists PDF reports currently supported package.

title: azschooldata: Fetch and Process Arizona School Data — azschooldata-package
text: Maintainer: Al Martin almartin@example.com

what: Build potential enrollment file URLs — build_enrollment_urls
title: Build potential enrollment file URLs — build_enrollment_urls
text: ADE uses various URL patterns across years. function generates list URLs try based observed patterns.

title: Build potential enrollment file URLs — build_enrollment_urls
Build potential enrollment file URLs — build_enrollment_urls
text: end_year School year end

title: Build potential enrollment file URLs — build_enrollment_urls
text: Character vector URLs try

title: Build potential enrollment file URLs — build_enrollment_urls
text: URL patterns discovered research: FY24 (2024): /2023/11/Oct1Enrollment2024_publish.xlsx FY19 (2019): /2019/10/Fiscal Year 2019 Accountabilty October Enrollment REDACTED.xlsx FY19 (2019): /2021/05/October 1 Enrollment 2018 -2019 UPDATED 2021 V2.xlsx FY18 (2018): /2021/05/2017-2018 October 1 Public Enrollment File UPDATED 2021 V2.xlsx FY16 (2016): /2017/06/october-1-fy16-enrollment.xlsx FY13 (2013): /2017/06/october-1-2012-2013.enrollment_count.xlsx

title: Custom Enrollment Grade Level Aggregates — enr_grade_aggs
Fetch Arizona enrollment data — fetch_enr
text: Downloads processes enrollment data Arizona Department Education's October 1 enrollment reports.

title: Fetch Arizona enrollment data — fetch_enr
Fetch Arizona enrollment data — fetch_enr
text: end_year school year. Year end academic year - eg 2023-24 school year year '2024'. Valid values 2011-2026. Data availability notes: Excel files available FY2011 (end_year 2011) onwards Earlier years (1990s-2000s) exist PDF reports supported ADE uses varying URL patterns across years; download may take seconds package tries multiple URL patterns tidy TRUE (default), returns data long (tidy) format subgroup column. FALSE, returns wide format. use_cache TRUE (default), uses locally cached data available. Set FALSE force re-download ADE.

title: Fetch Arizona enrollment data — fetch_enr
text: Data frame enrollment data. Wide format includes columns district_id, campus_id, names, enrollment counts demographic/grade. Tidy format pivots counts subgroup grade_level columns.

title: Fetch Arizona enrollment data — fetch_enr
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Get 2024 enrollment data (2023-24 school year) enr_2024 <- fetch_enr(2024)  # Get wide format enr_wide <- fetch_enr(2024, tidy = FALSE)  # Force fresh download (ignore cache) enr_fresh <- fetch_enr(2024, use_cache = FALSE)  # Get historical data from 2011 enr_2011 <- fetch_enr(2011)  # Filter to specific district phoenix_union <- enr_2024 |>   dplyr::filter(grepl("Phoenix Union", district_name, ignore.case = TRUE)) } # }

what: Fetch enrollment data for multiple years — fetch_enr_multi
title: Fetch enrollment data for multiple years — fetch_enr_multi
text: Downloads combines enrollment data multiple school years.

title: Fetch enrollment data for multiple years — fetch_enr_multi
Fetch enrollment data for multiple years — fetch_enr_multi
text: end_years Vector school year ends (e.g., c(2022, 2023, 2024)). Valid range 2011-2026. tidy TRUE (default), returns data long (tidy) format. use_cache TRUE (default), uses locally cached data available.

title: Fetch enrollment data for multiple years — fetch_enr_multi
text: Combined data frame enrollment data requested years

title: Fetch enrollment data for multiple years — fetch_enr_multi
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Get 3 years of data enr_multi <- fetch_enr_multi(2022:2024)  # Get full historical range enr_all <- fetch_enr_multi(2011:2025)  # Track enrollment trends enr_multi |>   dplyr::filter(is_state, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") |>   dplyr::select(end_year, n_students) } # }

what: Get available years for Arizona enrollment data — get_available_years
title: Get available years for Arizona enrollment data — get_available_years
text: Returns range school years enrollment data available Arizona Department Education.

title: Get available years for Arizona enrollment data — get_available_years
Get available years for Arizona enrollment data — get_available_years
text: list three elements: min_year earliest available school year end (e.g., 2011 2010-11) max_year latest available school year end (e.g., 2026 2025-26) description Human-readable description data availability

title: Get available years for Arizona enrollment data — get_available_years
code: get_available_years() #> $min_year #> [1] 2011 #>  #> $max_year #> [1] 2026 #>  #> $description #> [1] "Arizona enrollment data is available from 2010-11 (end_year 2011) through 2025-26 (end_year 2026). Data comes from the October 1 enrollment reports published by the Arizona Department of Education. Earlier years (1990s-2000s) exist only as PDF reports and are not currently supported." #>  # Returns list with min_year, max_year, and description

what: Download raw enrollment data from ADE — get_raw_enr
title: Download raw enrollment data from ADE — get_raw_enr
text: Downloads October 1 enrollment report Excel file ADE's website. ADE publishes enrollment counts annually breakdowns demographics.
